title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 February 2014 - XWiki
content:
<GuillaumeF> has quit  
00:24 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
00:31 <UCC> has quit  
01:20 <lucaa> has quit  
02:02 <Inge-> has quit  
02:07 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
03:07 <mflorea> has quit  
03:12 <xwikibot> has quit  
12:47 <vmassol> oh cool bot is back  
12:47 <tmortagne> vmassol: xwiki-commons-5.2.4 on central, you can do rendering now  
12:48 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne!  
12:54 <cjd> has quit  
12:59 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:19 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you should mention the synatx to use  
13:19 <vmassol> btw we shouldn't use the html macro when it can be avoided  
13:20 <gdelhumeau> how can I avoid it?  
13:20 <vmassol> [[label>>link]] :)  
13:20 <gdelhumeau> but the link is $xwiki.getURL()  
13:20 <vmassol> and?  
13:20 <vmassol> [[administer>>path:$xwiki.getURL()]]  
13:20 <gdelhumeau> ok sorry  
13:21 <vmassol> (xwiki syntax 2.1)  
13:23 <ClemensR> the issue XWIKI-9052 is still unresolved, but I think it is the same as XWIKI-9826, which is fixed  
13:38 <sburjan`> has quit  
13:39 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <evalica> has quit  
13:51 <vmassol> lucaa: done for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-535 enjoy  
13:54 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you forgot to release the repo on sonatype's nexus  
13:58 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> has quit  
14:18 <DarkKnightCZ> when was Requirement annotation added to xwiki?  
14:25 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: it's been deprectaed for a long time now :)  
14:25 <vmassol>  \* @since 1.8.1  
14:25 <vmassol> so introduced in 1.8.1 and deprecated in 3.1M1  
14:26 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ping  
14:26 <vmassol> (see my message above)  
14:26 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: back  
14:26 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I was waiting its closure  
14:26 <gdelhumeau> I mean I clicked on "close" and it took some time  
14:27 <gdelhumeau> anyway, it's fixed  
14:30 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ok  
14:31 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: well, so http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module+Local (example before 5.4) is not valid... but i guess that it's not a problem (if i don't want to fire events)... but how exactly can i register the new listener?  
14:32 <vmassol> what is not valid?  
14:32 <vmassol> it is valid  
14:32 <vmassol> it's just using a deprecated annotation  
14:32 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, even 5.4 example uses the Requirement annotation (eclipse cannot find it)  
14:32 <vmassol> are you sure you have the legacy module in your classpath?  
14:32 <vmassol> my guess is that you don't  
14:33 <vmassol> xwiki-commons-legacy-component-api in this case  
14:33 <lucaa> has quit  
14:33 <vmassol> but in any case it's best to update the example to use @Inject, I'll let you or tmortagne update the page ;)  
14:34 <vmassol> gtg  
14:34 <DarkKnightCZ> ok :)  
14:34 <DarkKnightCZ> i will leave it to tmortagne since i'm not even able to test that now :)  
14:38 <mflorea> has quit  
14:40 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: done  
14:42 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: thanks... by the way, how to register the event listener? i guess registering the class to observationmanager should do the trick?  
14:43 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: no need  
14:43 <tmortagne> it's automatically registered just by being an EventListener  
14:43 <tmortagne> observationmanager search all EventListener component at startup  
14:43 <tmortagne> s/component/components/  
14:50 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:54 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:03 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, and component logging works differently? (because logger.info() in onEvent doesnt show anything in stdout)  
15:05 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: what's you class package ? info is enabled only for org.xwiki by default  
15:05 <tmortagne> look at logback configuration file  
15:06 <lucaa> has quit  
15:06 <DarkKnightCZ> i've put  <logger name="path.to.superior.package" level="info" /> in my logback  
15:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <tmortagne> ok then it should work, you can look at logging admin section to see if it's been properly taken into account  
15:07 <tmortagne> sorry I have to go, back in about half an hour  
15:08 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, no problem... i will try several things  
15:19 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: well, so component has correct log level, even System.out.println doesnt print anything, is there a way, how to look what is registered into observer module?  
15:29 <lucaa> has quit  
15:33 <ClemensR> if System.out.println does not print anything, either someone has stolen the output stream, or more likely, the code with the print statement is not been executed  
15:37 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, i guess the listener is not registered to observer module  
15:38 <msmeria> vmassol: can you grant me commit rights on https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-newsletter ?  
15:39 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:45 <msmeria> tmortagne: hello. can you grant me rights on xwiki-contrib ?  
15:45 <msmeria> looks like vmassol is afk  
15:49 <vmassol> back  
15:49 <vmassol> msmeria: what's your github id?  
15:50 <msmeria> msmeria  
15:50 <vmassol> done  
15:51 <vmassol> note that your first and last name is missing in your github profile  
15:51 <vmassol> https://github.com/msmeria  
15:51 <msmeria> vmassol: merci  
15:51 <msmeria> I'll fill it in  
15:51 <lucaa> has quit  
15:52 <msmeria> vmassol: done  
15:52 <vmassol> nicer :)  
15:53 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: is your component listed in component.txt file ?  
15:54 <dpatriche> has quit  
15:54 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Component+Module#HComponentRegistration  
15:55 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yes it is... checking for typos now  
15:56 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, name of component is correct  
15:59 <tmortagne> if you component is properly listed and you have @Component and a unique @Named associated to you class extending EventListener all I can thing of is that you are not listening to the right events  
15:59 <tmortagne> s/thing/think/  
16:00 <DarkKnightCZ> well, onEvent should catch all events, right?  
16:01 <vmassol> you need to implement getEvents()  
16:03 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: not all events no  
16:04 <tmortagne> you are supposed to expose the event you want to listen  
16:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
16:10 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol, tmortagne: oh  
16:15 <DarkKnightCZ> which artifact contains observation events?  
16:25 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, it works now :) thanks  
16:26 <lucaa> has quit  
16:28 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: there is no specific artifact, anyone can come with custom events  
16:29 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yep... i needed document update/delete/create events (from xwiki-platform-legacy-observation, although these are deprecated)  
16:30 <tmortagne> it's not the right ones  
16:30 <tmortagne> they move to xwiki-platform-bridge  
16:30 <tmortagne> \*moved  
16:30 <tmortagne> when you have a \*-legacy-\* module in your dependencies it's generally not a good sign  
16:31 <tmortagne> updating http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module+Local  
16:31 <DarkKnightCZ> yep :)  
16:31 <tmortagne> forgot about that  
16:33 <DarkKnightCZ> and using hql in components is still the same? (obtaining querymanager from componentmanager?)  
16:34 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: oh, and you can also edit componentManager.lookup (since it's no longer valid) on that extension page  
16:37 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: should be ok now  
16:38 <tmortagne> could be simplified a bit actually but at least it does not use any deprecated class/method anymore  
16:38 <DarkKnightCZ> yep  
16:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: regarding https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/261 does it mean the localization module automatically handles single quotes?  
16:40 <vmassol> (see sergiu's comment)  
16:40 <vmassol> looks strange  
16:41 <vmassol> since having 2 single quotes is a properties standard AFAIK  
16:41 <joel1> Hm... I have a profile Xwiki > Xwiki Space > Data types > Xwiki User Class > Profile of x  
16:42 <tmortagne> vmassol: having 2 single quotes does not have anything to do with properties, ' is MessageFormat  
16:42 <joel1> But all the other exist in Xwiki > User directory  
16:42 <vmassol> yes tmortagne that's what I meant actually  
16:42 <tmortagne> if you don't double the ' it means the following {0} will be escaped  
16:42 <tmortagne> so yes as sdumitriu said the double ' is required  
16:42 <vmassol> ok so msmeria you must be wrong somewhere...  
16:44 <msmeria> vmassol: wrong about what ?  
16:44 <vmassol> see above at 16:40  
16:45 <vmassol> (paris time)  
16:46 <msmeria> vmassol, tmortagne: see http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/attachment/27206/Descriptor%20of%20the%20wiki%20-test-%20%28XWiki.XWikiServerTest%29%20-%20XWiki.png  
16:46 <vmassol> hmm rendering is failing  
16:47 <tmortagne> msmeria: you don' have parameters in this translation  
16:47 <tmortagne> the message is parsed by MessageFormat only if there is provided parameters  
16:47 <tmortagne> this means that kepping {0} is totally wrong anyway  
16:47 <msmeria> yeah so that's why I wanted to remove one of them  
16:48 <tmortagne> you don't see what you fixed here  
16:48 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: fixed http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10033  
16:48 <tmortagne> you are mixing stuff here  
16:48 <tmortagne> the main issue is not about '  
16:48 <tmortagne> you have a {0} and no parameter...  
16:49 <tmortagne> what us wrong is not that you have two '  
16:49 <gdelhumeau> msmeria: yes?  
16:49 <tmortagne> msmeria: you did not fixed anything  
16:50 <tmortagne> it's not right to have {0}  
16:50 <msmeria> tmortagne: I see  
16:50 <tmortagne> look at what gdelhumeau did which is the real fix  
16:51 <msmeria> I did that PR before gdelhumeaureally fixed it  
16:51 <tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/86339abedffd045c7182a79a40381700e2994149#diff-0  
16:51 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
16:51 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: by the way your fix is not complete either  
16:51 <tmortagne> you both fixed only one of the two issues :)  
16:51 <tmortagne> you need to remove one ' since there is nothing to escape  
16:52 <gdelhumeau> oh yes  
16:52 <gdelhumeau> -\_-  
16:52 <msmeria> I didn't know how to fix the https one so I only fixed one..  
16:52 <msmeria> anyway...  
16:52 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: unfortunately it's the same line but that's the idea :)  
16:52 <msmeria> somebody fix it now :)  
16:53 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: do you want me to do it?  
16:53 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I don't plan to do it ;)  
16:53 <gdelhumeau> fixing  
16:55 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:58 <gdelhumeau> msmeria, tmortagne: done  
16:59 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: gracias!  
17:00 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: replace starting with start please  
17:00 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:04 <lucaa> hello guys  
17:05 <gdelhumeau> -\_- I hope it is good now  
17:05 <lucaa> if I put the xwiki.extension.features in the parent  pom of my extension, will it be inherited in the child pom?  
17:05 <lucaa> knowing that the xar, the actual extension that will be installed, is in a submodule  
17:06 <lucaa> this is the extension: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/macro-pdfviewer  
17:06 <lucaa> and the actual artifact that will be installed is the xar, in the wiki module  
17:11 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: yes, it is now. thanks!  
17:24 <msmeria> has quit  
17:37 <lucaa> guys, I updated the pdf viewer macro, I released it from maven and I put the ludovic:xwiki-macro-pdfviewer as a feature in it (the id of the old extension on the page). Now I have a wiki on which I would like to update this extension, but I don't manage to see an update proposed in the EM UI...  
17:38 <lucaa> I search extensions, I can find xwiki macro - pdf viewer  
17:38 <lucaa> it says "functionallites" ludovic:xwiki-macro-pdfviewer  
17:38 <lucaa> but I don't see it as an upgrade  
17:38 <lucaa> actually, I  think I had this problem before, and it was a bug that was fixed in the mean time... but I am on version 5.2.1  
18:02 <tmortagne> lucaa: it's not a bug  
18:03 <tmortagne> the updater only search ids  
18:04 <tmortagne> that's because it's impossible to search for anything else than id in a maven repository so for now the API only contains what works for all kind of repositories  
18:04 <tmortagne> you have to search for the new one and it will replace the one you have currently  
18:05 <tmortagne> now about xwiki.extension.features in parent will work but it does not make any sense for me  
18:06 <tmortagne> parent is supposed to have several children or then it's useless and I doubt you want to have several different extension exposing the same features  
18:11 <ClemensR> locally the WCAG tests fail on me ... anyone else ?  
18:15 <lucaa> tmortagne: the alias not being found as an upgrade is a bug, XWIKI-9808  
18:15 <lucaa> (I remember because I reported it)  
18:15 <tmortagne> lucaa: it's not the same thing  
18:15 <tmortagne> XWIKI-9808 is not about the updater  
18:15 <tmortagne> it's that you get a install button instead of a upgrade button  
18:16 <ClemensR> ah, never mind my  validation issues, it is because my admin has some odd subscriptions on his profile page  
18:16 <tmortagne> the fact that the updater does not find your extension is completely different and supporting it is a new feature, not a bugfix  
18:16 <lucaa> tmortagne: it's the same case, I know that there was a nuance on that issue, but I am talking about the same thing as I was talking then  
18:17 <lucaa> no, not the updater. When I search the extension by it's new name, it appears as a new extension, although I have the old version installed  
18:17 <lucaa> that's what I meant  
18:17 <lucaa> I remember the nuance  
18:17 <lucaa> and this is XWIKI-9808, iirc  
18:17 <tmortagne> ok then yes it's XWIKI-9808  
18:17 <tmortagne> I missread you first messages I guess  
18:18 <lucaa> I might have expressed them badly also  
18:18 <tmortagne> but it's UI bug, if you click on install it will ugrade it  
18:18 <lucaa> :)  
18:18 <lucaa> it's just that you don't click on the button because you're afraid of what will happen  
18:19 <tmortagne> sure  
18:23 <Slashman> has quit  
18:45 <mflorea> has quit  
18:53 <vmassol> hmm strange the rendering build is flickering for me  
18:53 <vmassol> it constantly fails but at different places whenever I run it  
18:53 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:56 <woshilapin> Hi devs, how can I create a new document from a template in Velocity (I tested CopyDocument but it didn't copy the Object from the template)?  
18:58 <gdelhumeau> it didn't copy the object ?  
18:58 <gdelhumeau> sounds like a bug to me  
18:58 <woshilapin> Maybe I didn't do it right  
18:59 <woshilapin> I use DocumentReference for copyDocument function  
18:59 <woshilapin> Is it right?  
18:59 <gdelhumeau> it should  
18:59 <woshilapin> Should I save something?  
18:59 <woshilapin> Or the copyDocument should be enough  
19:01 <gdelhumeau> it should be enough  
19:01 <woshilapin> At least, copyDocument is the right way to do?  
19:02 <GuillaumeF> has quit  
19:09 <tekzilla> recently had some trouble with downgrading, had to remove some extensions etc. now i'm missing the tools to list users/groups and edit them  
19:10 <tekzilla> is that part of an extension i'm missing or are the permissions probably screwed up for my user  
19:13 <ClemensR> looks to me like missing pages  
19:14 <ClemensR> where are the "tools to list users" gone amiss exactly ?  
19:14 <gdelhumeau> tekzilla: which version ?  
19:14 <gdelhumeau> tekzilla: in a subwiki ?  
19:15 <tekzilla> gdelhumeau: 5.4 now, its the main wiki  
19:15 <gdelhumeau> ok  
19:15 <gdelhumeau> I know there was a bad commit in 5.3  
19:15 <gdelhumeau> but in 5.4, nothing that I know  
19:15 <tekzilla> ok so if the main UI is installed correctly, i should see the users and groups  
19:15 <gdelhumeau> yes  
19:16 <tekzilla> alright thanks, i'll see whats wrong with it  
19:16 <gdelhumeau> ok  
19:16 <gdelhumeau> good evening guys  
19:17 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
19:22 <ClemensR> tekzilla: you might check how your XWiki.AdminUsersSheet is doing  
19:24 <ClemensR> if I remove that page, indeed the corresponding section in the admin is gone  
20:01 <lucaa> has quit  
20:18 <tekzilla> ClemensR: thank you very much for checking that! that might help out alot  
20:18 <tekzilla> i'll have to check it out later  
20:19 <ClemensR> ah, ok. anyway, I hope it really helps
